event: Commemoration of Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps
description: In Berdyansk, a commemorative event was held to mark the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps. The event, organized by the Russian Military Historical Society, included a flower-laying ceremony and an educational lecture at the city history museum, featuring video chronicles of the Nuremberg Tribunal.
original:
In Berdyansk they paid tribute to the prisoners of fascist concentration camps. Today, April 11, is the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Concentration Camps. In many countries, various commemorative events are held, meetings of former prisoners, events of worship in their memory, laying flowers at the graves and burial places of victims of fascism.
Berdyansk was no exception.

Under the auspices of the Russian Military Historical Society, with the participation of youth organizations, representatives of the Communist Party, and the Union of Officers, not just a flower-laying ceremony was held, but also an educational event.

At the city history museum, visitors watched and listened to a historical lecture in which video chronicles of the Nuremberg Tribunal were shown. In these chronicles, the Minister of Justice of Nazi Germany, Janing, gained courage and courage and spoke in court about the Nazi atrocities against humanity. Perhaps he was the only one among the Nazi defendants who sincerely repented.👉Quality news —@berdyanskru

description: Roscosmos successfully launched the Angara-A5 launch vehicle with the Orion upper stage and a test payload from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. The launch vehicle operated normally, and the upper stage separated from the third stage, injecting the test payload into the specified orbit.
original:
As reported by the Roscosmos state corporation, on April 11 at 12:00:00.164 Moscow time, the first launch of the Angara-A5 launch vehicle with the Orion upper stage and a test payload was carried out from site 1A of the Vostochny Cosmodrome.
The launch vehicle operated normally, the upper stage separated from the third stage of the rocket and is currently injecting the test payload into the specified orbit.
This was the sixth launch of a Russian launch vehicle in 2024, including the second from Vostochny. For Angara-A5, this flight became the fourth in history (including the first from Vostochny), for the family of upper stages D - the 337th in history (including the first for Orion).
The Angara-A5 launch vehicle was manufactured by the State Space Research and Production Center named after M.V. Khrunichev, Orion upper stage - Rocket and Space Corporation Energia named after S.P. Korolev (part of the Roscosmos State Corporation).
This launch began flight development tests of the Amur space rocket complex with Angara heavy-class launch vehicles at the Vostochny cosmodrome.
The Angara-A5 launch vehicle is environmentally friendly and does not use toxic fuel components, unlike the Proton-M launch vehicle, which the Angara will completely replace in the near future.

Moreover, such bribe-takers usually get promoted under Kolokoltsev. Even if a polygraph shows that an employee took bribes, then for the leadership of the Ministry of Internal Affairs this serves as a signal to “hush up” the situation and promote him in his career
The Cheka-OGPU has more than once talked about the thorny path of the former police officer of the 27th department of the GUUR of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia, and now an employee of the GUEBiPK of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia, Dmitry Dolgushin. In 2012, Dolgushin, being an operative of the 27th department of the Main Directorate for Criminal Investigation of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia, received $10,000 from a citizen for assistance in initiating a criminal case. Dolgushin did not provide any help. In February 2023, an application regarding this fact was submitted to the 9th inspection department of the Main Directorate for Security of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. However, the results of the audit were “hushed up” and “hidden”. The Ministry of Internal Affairs knows how to do this. It has now become clear that Dolgushin was interviewed using a polygraph. The polygraph results directly indicated that Dolgushin received money. Moreover, witnesses interviewed by the State Security Service confirmed the fact that Dolgushin received money from a citizen. During the GUSB survey, it turned out that Dolgushin received a Vertu phone from a citizen (at that time worth about $4,000). Based on the results of the inspection, the 9th department of the Inspection Directorate of the Main Directorate of Internal Security of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia sent an information letter to the GUEBiPK about the results of the inspection carried out in relation to Dolgushin, incl. about the polygraph results (that Dolgushin took money for assistance in criminal prosecution). And what happened next.
But the topic was simply “hushed up”, and the results of all checks were hidden and not transferred to the Investigative Committee.
As a result, to this day, Dolgushin is the detective officer for the Department of Internal Affairs of the 13th department of the Directorate “P” of the GUEBiPK of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia and lives happily ever after.

description: Ukraine's mobilization potential is estimated to be around 5 million recruits, with the upper limit of 500 thousand people voiced by Vladimir Zelensky likely to be adjusted downwards. The full mobilization potential is not yet half a million, but Ukraine still has the opportunity to continue the war.
original:
How many more people can Ukraine mobilize? We have studied the assessments of our colleagues - and are talking in detail about the potential reserve of the Ukrainian Supreme Soviet. The parameters of the new mobilization have yet to be approved by the Ukrainian authorities - after the adoption of the corresponding bill in the Verkhovna Rada, where it is currently undergoing its second reading.

The upper limit of 500 thousand people voiced by Vladimir Zelensky will likely be adjusted downwards - but even in the most ambitious scenario, Ukraine still has the opportunity to continue the war.

Moreover, the full mobilization potential of the Armed Forces of Ukraine is not even half a million recruits, but (in theory) approximately five million. In any case, our colleagues came to these conclusions after conducting a detailed demographic analysis of the reserves available to the Ukrainian army.

We have studied their calculations in detail - and we tell you the main thing you need to know about the mobilization potential of Ukraine in the third year of a full-scale war.

———Open material without VPN.Meduza Ukraine can mobilize up to 500 thousand people. It seems that this is a lot - ...the second reading of the bill on mobilization is taking place in the Verkhovna Rada these days. The initiative caused a lot of criticism and provoked tension both in the...

description: Russian special services detained Antonina Martynova, wife of Novaya Gazeta Europe's editor-in-chief Kirill Martynov, on suspicion of attempted murder of her own daughter. The case was reopened in the Novgorod Regional Court, allegedly as a means to blackmail and recruit Martynov for Russian propaganda purposes.
original:
Forwarded from: Gulagu.net
In Russia, journalists' wives are taken hostage. The wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe, Antonina Martynova, was detained on suspicion of attempted murder of her own daughter.

In the Stavropol Territory, Russian special services officers detained Antonina Martynova, suspected of attempted murder of her own daughter, media reports. The wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe, Kirill Martynov, was put on the wanted list back in 2007. According to the prosecution, she allegedly deliberately pushed her two-year-old daughter on the staircase - as a result of the blow, the girl fell, broke her jaw and received a head injury. Martynova argued that the girl tripped herself, but witnesses then pointed to the guilt of the editor-in-chief’s wife. In 2008, Antonina was found guilty by a jury and, under recognizance not to leave the place, left Russia. Pro-government publications claim that she has been wanted since then. Now the case against Martynova has been resumed in the Novgorod Regional Court.

Obviously, the purpose of the arrest is to take hostage a close friend of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta.Europe, Kirill Martynov, for the purpose of blackmail and possible recruitment for using the famous media outlet as a tool of Russian propaganda. We know that previously the FSB, through third parties, transferred fabricated materials to Martynov for publication in order to discredit the founder of Gulagu.net, Vladimir Osechkin, and tried to use him in the fall of 2023 in a campaign against us, but after fact-checking and verification, Martynov refused to publish these materials and did not help counterintelligence FSB in this special operation.

Our words of support to Kirill and Antonina Martynov and the entire team of “Novaya Gazeta. Europe”!🕊✊And once again to everyone who can - U E Z J A Y T E. Don’t become hostages and take care of yourself and all of us, please.

description: American football player and actor OJ Simpson has died at the age of 76 after battling cancer. Simpson was acquitted of murdering his ex-wife in the 90s, despite public perception of his guilt. He later served time in prison for robbery.
original:
American football player and actor OJ Simpson has died. He was 76 years old. Simpson is a defendant in one of the most high-profile cases of the 90s, he was accused of murdering his ex-wife. In a statement, O. J. Simpson's family said that he died surrounded by children and loved ones, fighting cancer. OJ Simpson is an American Football League star and was inducted into the Professional Football Hall of Fame. He also acted in films, for example, playing the role of Detective Northberg in the Naked Gun trilogy.

The actor gained notoriety after being accused of murdering his ex-wife due to the testimony of a random witness to the crime who came to the victim’s house. Simpson was acquitted by a jury and avoided the death penalty. At the same time, the American public was confident of his guilt, as indicated by a number of irrefutable evidence. Simpson later ended up in prison anyway for robbery in 2007; he was released in the fall of 2017.

description: In 2009, a monument to Russian poet Alexander Pushkin was erected in Asmara, the capital of Eritrea. The monument features a capsule with soil from Pushkin's grave and was created by Moscow sculptor Nikolai Kuznetsov-Muromsky.
original:
Monument to Alexander Pushkin in the capital of EritreaIn 2009, a monument to the Russian poet Alexander Pushkin was erected in the city of Asmara (the capital of Eritrea).

At the base of the monument there is a capsule with soil from the poet’s grave.

During the opening ceremony, thousands of residents gathered in the capital on Pushkin Square.

The state in East Africa considers itself the homeland of the poet's ancestors.

The author of the monument was the Moscow sculptor Nikolai Kuznetsov-Muromsky, who is also the author of the bust of Pushkin in Ljubljana and Belgrade.

The works of the Russian poet have since been included in the curriculum of secondary schools in Eritrea. Smile & Wave

He is already conscious, trying to communicate with us and gaining strength for rehabilitation. We have no doubt that he will fully recover," his wife said.

description: Military analyst Taras Chmut emphasized the need for a balanced approach to reservation, as Ukraine's economy relies on maintaining its defense. He highlighted the challenge of finding the right balance between leaving people in the economy and taking them to fight, citing instances where contracts with the Defense Forces were interrupted due to personnel shortages at enterprises.
original:
We fight while the economy works: Chmut commented on the reservation.

Ukraine is able to maintain its defense while the economy is working, so the approach to reservation should be as balanced as possible. This was stated by military analyst, volunteer Taras Chmut, commenting on the reservation problem.

According to him, now there is a big problem with finding the golden line between where we leave people in the economy and where we take people to fight. After all, contracts with the Defense Forces are sometimes interrupted due to the fact that there is a lack of personnel at the required enterprise.

"We had contracts that were not fulfilled due to the fact that there was simply no one to do it, because someone was mobilized somewhere, and the plant cannot work. And so, in business, in many companies, people are taken away. People don't mind, there are normal people, everything is fine. But some company stops at this, and that's it - the economy does not receive, there is no production, there are no salaries, there is no money. And the army gets one more person," Chmut summarized. TRUKHA⚡️Ukraine | Send news

description: Ukraine's President Zelensky has lowered the conscription age from 27 to 25, which risks further reducing the already small generation of young men in the country. This demographic problem is attributed to a sharp decline in birth rates in the 1990s due to economic depression and uncertainty about the future.
original:
New York Times: Kyiv risks destroying an entire generation of Ukrainians with new mobilization law

Earlier this month, President Zelensky “took the politically painful step” of lowering the conscription age from 27 to 25, as the NYT writes, Ukraine faces a critical demographic problem that has been brewing for a long time: there are very few young men in the country.

As the newspaper notes, healthy men under the age of 30 - the backbone of the majority of the armed forces - are part of the smallest generation in the modern history of Ukraine. The publication emphasizes that this is due to a sharp decline in the birth rate in the country after the collapse of the USSR due to “economic depression” and “uncertainty about the future” in the 1990s. As a result, there are more than twice as many 40-year-old men in Ukraine as 20-year-olds.

Zelensky's decision to draft men into the army from the age of 25 risks further reduction of this small generation of Ukrainians, the publication says.NytimesCan Ukraine Find New Soldiers Without Decimating a Whole Generation?After two years of war, Ukraine's exhausted forces desperately need new recruits, but fighting-age men are in historically short supply.

event: Interline Agreement between Aeroflot and KrasAvia
description: Aeroflot and KrasAvia entered into an interline agreement, allowing passengers to issue a single ticket for flights. This agreement expands Aeroflot's flight geography from the Krasnoyarsk hub through partner flights.
original:
Forwarded from: FrequentFlyers
Aeroflot and KrasAvia entered into an interline agreement Aeroflot and KrasAvia entered into an interline agreement that will allow passengers to issue a single ticket for airline flights. Thanks to the interline agreement, Aeroflot will be able to expand the geography of flights from the Krasnoyarsk hub at the expense of partner flights.

Shared transportation through Krasnoyarsk will be carried out on flights under the codes SU and KV. The ticket is issued at the rates of the Optimum Economy class group. Free baggage allowance is 23 kg on all stages of transportation. The carry-on baggage allowance is according to the rules of the carrier: for Aeroflot flights 10 kg, for KrasAvia flights - 5 kg. Payment for excess baggage and additional services is made from the transport company according to its rules. There is no through check-in of passengers and baggage to the final destination.

In its summer schedule, Aeroflot Group offers passengers flights to 29 destinations from the Krasnoyarsk hub: Moscow, St. Petersburg, Sochi, Blagoveshchensk, Chelyabinsk, Magadan, Chita, Irkutsk, Khabarovsk, Kazan, Mirny, Mineralnye Vody, Neryungri, Novy Urengoy, Novosibirsk , Surgut, Yekaterinburg, Tyumen, Vladivostok, Yakutsk, Almaty, Beijing, Bangkok, Bishkek, Phuket, Harbin, Astana, Osh and Tashkent.

As part of the interline agreement, passengers have access to the following KrasAvia routes from Krasnoyarsk: Abakan, Tomsk, Novokuznetsk, Barnaul, Gorno-Altaisk, Kyzyl, Tura, Baykit, Vanavara, Turukhansk, Podkamennaya Tunguska, Severo-Yeniseisk, Kodinsk, Igarka, Svetlogorsk ( Krasnoyarsk Territory), Khatanga and Ulaanbaatar.

In the fall, Aeroflot conducted an audit of KrasAvia for compliance with the requirements of the international IOSA standard, following which it noted the airline’s high level of preparedness for cooperation: a decent level of service, high regularity of flights and other indicators. The following stages of cooperation are currently being discussed: expansion of the route network and development of online sales of joint transportation. https://www.frequentflyers.ru/2024/04/11/su_kv/@frequentflyers

description: The heavy Angara rocket was launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome after two previous delays due to technical issues. The rocket, developed by the Khrunichev State Space Research and Production Center, is intended to replace the Proton-M launch vehicles and is primarily used by the Russian Ministry of Defense.
original:
❗️The heavy Angara rocket launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. Its launch was delayed twice. Initially, the rocket with the Orion upper stage and test payload was supposed to launch on April 9. However, a few minutes before the launch it was canceled and postponed a day.

General Director of Roscosmos Yuri Borisov explained that the first launch of Angara was canceled automatically due to a failure of the pressurization system of the oxidizer tank of the central unit. The second launch attempt was also canceled, citing a malfunction in the engine start control system. The rocket launch was postponed another day.

———

Angara rockets are developed and produced by the Khrunichev State Space Research and Production Center. The main customer of these missiles is the Russian Ministry of Defense.

The Angara should replace the Proton-M launch vehicles, the family of which has been in operation since the mid-1960s. According to the developers, flight tests of light and heavy Angara missiles are planned to be completed in 2025. TelegramRIA Novosti Footage of the Angara launch from Vostochny0:37VIEW MESSAGE

event: Discovery of Ancient Roman Art in Pompeii
description: Archaeologists uncovered unique ancient Roman art in Pompeii, buried under ash after a volcanic eruption. The excavations revealed a room with frescoes depicting Greek mythological characters, including Helen of Troy, Prince Paris, and Apollo. The floor features a mosaic composed of over a million fragments.
original:
Archaeologists have discovered unique works of ancient Roman art in Pompeii, which were buried under a layer of ash after a volcanic eruption. During the excavations, a room with ancient frescoes on the walls was discovered, the BBC reports. They depict characters from Greek myths, including Helen of Troy, Prince Paris and the god Apollo.

The floor of the room is covered with a mosaic consisting of more than a million fragments, archaeologists note.

One of the frescoes depicts the god Apollo trying to seduce the priestess Cassandra. On the other - the meeting of Prince Paris and the beautiful Helen. According to legend, it was this famous ancient Greek story that caused the start of the Trojan War.

In February, it was reported that students used artificial intelligence to decipher ancient Roman manuscripts that were burned during the eruption of Vesuvius. Scientists believe that this opens the way to deciphering all the other texts found in the villa in the ancient Roman city of Herculaneum. Photo: BBC Subscribe to Rain's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

event: Exposure of Fraudulent Disability Certificate Scheme
description: The cyber police of Rivne Oblast, along with a police officer, exposed a resident of Mlyn who offered men facing mobilization fictitious disability certificates to avoid service. The certificates cost 8,800 USD, with half paid upfront and the rest after receiving the document. The suspect was detained and faces up to nine years in prison.
original:
Forwarded from: CyberpoliceUA
Transported men with "disabilities" abroad: a resident of Rivne Oblast will appear before the court The cyber police of Rivne Oblast together with a police officer of the Duben Regional Police Department managed to expose the perpetrator under the procedural guidance of the district prosecutor's office.

At first, it was about working abroad, and then the man from Mlyn offered men who were to be mobilized to go to another country by registering a fictitious disability. The cost of the fictitious certificate was 8,800 US dollars. Half of the amount had to be paid immediately, the rest - after receiving the "document". The "entrepreneur" was detained on January 4 this year while receiving the second part of the funds. He was placed in a temporary detention center and informed about the suspicion of committing a crime.⚖️ The court chose a preventive measure in the form of detention with the possibility of bail in the amount of 605 thousand hryvnias. After some time, the suspect paid it, so he is currently at liberty. The investigators of the Dubensky RVP completed the pre-trial investigation under part 3 of Article 332 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine and sent the materials of the criminal proceedings with the indictment to the court. A 32-year-old resident of Mlyniv may face up to nine years in prison. It is known that a case is currently being heard in a court in the Lviv region accusing him of committing a crime under a similar article. Rivne Oblast Police We are online: FB|Web|X|TG

description: Political scientist Igor Reiterovich expressed concerns that the new law on mobilization may demoralize the military and fail to address key issues, such as veterans and demobilization. He highlighted the lack of a clear perspective for military personnel and the need for respect and understanding.
original:
The new law on mobilization will not solve the problems with the recruitment of troops and may demoralize the military.

This opinion was expressed by political scientist Igor Reiterovich on the air of “Topics with Moseychuk”.

Reiterovich noted that the document, in particular, did not resolve the issue of veterans and demobilization.

“The problem has not been solved. And this law does not solve the problem. The military speaks about this directly. Many, if you read, write: “You have passed a law that is, to a certain extent, empty. We won’t get as many people as we would like,” he says.

According to the expert, it is a myth that if veterans are allowed to demobilize, they will all leave on the same day, after 36 months.

“This is not so. The experience of all the countries that were mentioned, for example Croatia, is very indicative... There, when people have such a perspective, they often continue to serve. Because they have an understanding that they are treated with respect,” – noted Reiterovich.

He drew attention to some, in his opinion, strange points of the document. In particular, the rule on the conscript’s electronic account, which is still not ready.

“I will be happy to register it, because I want to understand what is happening there. But it says that the Cabinet of Ministers will only create it, develop it for two months, but after two months I must agree on my data,” the expert is surprised.

Reiterovich is confident that the new law can lead to demoralization of the military.

“They (the military - ed.) say directly - we need an understanding of the perspective. We didn’t get it. We can’t do that!” – he summed up. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

South Korean Prime Minister Han Dong-hun, leader of the ruling People Power party, resigned after his party's defeat in elections to the National Assembly (unicameral parliament) yesterday.

According to the results of voting in the 300-member parliament, opposition democrats won 175 seats against the ruling party's 108 seats, thereby maintaining control over it. And since South Korean democrats are more loyal to Russia and China as opposed to the pro-American leadership, they will, as before, maintain a cautious, balanced position towards Russia.

Any more significant changes in Seoul’s political course towards Moscow are possible only if the opposition impeaches pro-American President Yoon Seok-lyul, with whom more than 55% of the country’s population is dissatisfied. But we will soon find out about this too.⚔️WELDS - SUBSCRIBE

original:

Money to compensate for the damage caused to apartments and houses by Ukrainian Armed Forces missiles in March will begin to be paid next week. Deputy Governor Alexey Parikin spoke about this.

“We have already transferred the funds that we allocated from the reserve fund on Monday (ed. - April 8) to the social security department. Accordingly, we will now begin payments,” he noted during a meeting of the Sevastopol government.

description: The Museum of Victory, in collaboration with the International Research Center of the Second World War, organized an exhibition to preserve the historical truth about the Stalag XVIII D death camp in Maribor, where over 5,000 Soviet prisoners of war died. The exhibition aims to raise awareness about the tragic episode and counteract Nazi ideology.
original:
Forwarded from: Museum of Victory
“Stalag XVIII D. 5000 steps into immortality” is more than an exhibition. This is an action aimed at preserving and protecting the historical truth from the oblivion and irresponsible attitude of a number of European countries, the Baltic states and Ukraine, where we see the germs of Nazism, towards the past.

In the summer of 1941, a completely closed, fenced and guarded death camp “Russenlager” (Russian camp) was organized in Maribor. More than 5 thousand Soviet prisoners of war died here from disease, hunger and harsh conditions.

Employees of the International Research Center of the Second World War help preserve the memory of the feat of Soviet soldiers, engage in archival work, and hold conferences. Unfortunately, their work does not always find understanding among European politicians. This is precisely what confirms that the need for a global counteraction to Nazi ideology has not disappeared. The Victory Museum actively cooperates with the Center in Maribor. Together, we created an exhibition that draws public attention to this tragic episode of the war.

The exhibition in the Krasnogorsk branch of the Victory Museum tells about the history of the camp, the conditions of detention of prisoners, the facts of their mass death, commanders and staff. Archival documents and research, photographs, letters and newspapers of prisoners, and memories of eyewitnesses are presented here. Museum of Victory

event: Adoption of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea
description: The Constitution of the Republic of Crimea was adopted, completing the process of the region's entry into the Russian Federation. The Constitution enshrines the status and territory of Crimea, which cannot be changed without a referendum. This differs from the Ukrainian period, where there were no guarantees against changes to territorial-administrative units.
original:
RIA Novosti CrimeaAlbum, Exactly ten years ago the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea was adopted.

This completed the process of entry of the Republic...How does the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea differ from the basic law of the region in the Ukrainian period? Lawyer Grigory Demidov, who was part of the commission for preparing the draft Constitution of the Republic of Kazakhstan in 2014, told RIA Novosti Crimea about this. "The status of Crimea, as well as its territory are enshrined in the constitutions of the Republic of Kazakhstan and Russia and cannot be changed without the consent of the republic, until a referendum is held,” he said. Under Ukraine, according to him, “there was a wild infringement of status and rights.” There were no guarantees that Kyiv would not change the boundaries of one or another territorial-administrative unit.

Read more in our material. Subscribe to RIA Novosti CrimeaRIA News CrimeaTerritory, languages and land: top differences between the constitutions of Crimea under the Russian Federation and Ukraine April 11 marks ten years since the adoption of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea, which guaranteed the region real status, powers and consideration of the interests of the re...

description: A photographer from Buryatia used his drone to rescue a calf from a pack of dogs. He flew the drone towards the sound of barking, scaring the dogs away with sharp maneuvers. The calf, initially motionless, eventually recovered after the photographer checked on it and stayed with it until it rested.
original:
Forwarded from: Gazeta.Ru
A photographer from Buryatia saved a calf from a flock of dogs with a drone. Sergey Eliseev, in a conversation with Gazeta.Ru, said that he was photographing ducks when he heard a loud and incessant barking, so he decided to send the drone to the sound. On the drone screen, he saw how the dogs were attacking the calf.💬“The distance was 300 meters, and there was a river and a wetland between us, so I couldn’t approach. Since the drone was already in flight, I decided to fly towards the sound and see what was happening. Well, I saw this picture. I know that animals are scared by the sound of a quadcopter. I decided to use sharp maneuvers to scare the dogs and drive them away. The dogs never came back,” the man said.

According to Eliseev, the calf lay motionless for another half hour. He went to him to check, and was with the animal until it rested.👏to the operator for his ingenuity

original:
⚠️🇱🇻🇺🇦Ukraine and Latvia signed a security agreement👥The President of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyi, announced this after a meeting with the President of Latvia, Edgars Rinkevychs:

We have just signed a bilateral security agreement between our countries together with the President of Latvia, Edgars Rinkevičs. <...> Thank you friendly Latvia! This is exactly the specificity and predictability that our struggle for freedom and independence needs. 🗒According to the agreement, Latvia undertakes to help Ukraine in defense against Russian aggression, help with recovery and reconstruction, protection of critical infrastructure, demining, unmanned technologies and cyber security:

This year, the country will provide military support in the amount of about 112 million euros. In addition, Latvia will provide defense aid for 0.25% of GDP every year. This agreement became the ninth security agreement for Ukraine, the previous ones were concluded with Great Britain, Germany, France, Denmark, Canada, Italy, the Netherlands and Finland.

description: The New York Times reports that Ukraine faces a critical demographic constraint, with a severe shortage of young men to recruit into the army. The country's birth rate has been declining since the collapse of the Soviet Union, and the current generation of men under 30 is the smallest in Ukraine's modern history.
original:
⚡️New York Times: “Can Ukraine find new soldiers without exterminating an entire generation?” A year ago, such a publication simply could not have appeared in the Western press. It was impossible to even imagine - an article that says that the Reich is coming out on the edge of a demographic abyss.

The New York Times writes that the estimated million men who serve in the Ukrainian army are exhausted and exhausted. Many soldiers have been at the front for two years. Tens [that's right - hundreds] of thousands of people died or were seriously injured. New recruits are desperately needed. But Ukraine faces a critical demographic constraint that has been brewing for a long time: there are very few young men.

Healthy men under 30, the backbone of most armed forces, are part of the smallest generation in Ukraine's modern history. Ukraine can increase its troops only if it emasculates an entire generation - those born in the first decades after the collapse of the Soviet Union as the birth rate fell. In 1991, Ukrainian women had an average of 1.9 children. Ten years later, the birth rate had dropped to 1.1 children.

Zelensky's decision to conscript men starting at age 25 risks further shrinking this small generation of Ukrainians. And many of the limited number of 25- and 26-year-old men—about 467,000, according to government estimates for 2022—are already serving in the military, living in the liberated territories and outside Ukraine. Others have jobs or disabilities that exempt them from military service.

At the same time, the number of births decreased by almost half from 2021 to 2023. Some 800,000 Ukrainian women aged 18 to 34 have fled to EU countries. At the moment, the absence of women plays a larger role in Ukrainian demography than the recruitment of men. But lower conscription ages risk shrinking the small generation even further.

The embodiment of the slogan “until the last Ukrainian” has acquired clear outlines in demographic calculations. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

original:

Now the road workers are working on the development of plant soil, preparing for the installation of the lower layer of a two-layer base made of crushed stone-sand mixture, dismantling the crushed stone base, installing rainwater drainage, subgrade, installing side stones, work is underway to rebuild water supply networks, install culverts, rebuild external communication networks.

description: Volunteer Taras Chmut advocates for mobilization into the army from the age of 20, citing the devastating impact of the war on Ukraine, with hundreds of thousands of people killed and maimed. He believes this is necessary for the country's survival.

Hundreds of thousands of people in Ukraine have died and been maimed because of the war, said volunteer Taras Chmut.

In this regard, he calls for mobilization into the army from the age of 20.

“In my opinion, mobilization should take place from the age of 20. We have lost too much time. If we want to survive as a country, we must turn our face to the war, accept it as a reality and start doing something about it. Otherwise, it’s all in vain , hundreds of thousands of people who died, who were maimed, who are dying today, as we speak here. It’s all in vain,” Chmut said.

Let us remind you that Zelensky recently signed a law reducing the age of mobilization from 27 to 25 years.

description: The Angara-A5 heavy rocket successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome on its third attempt. This marks a significant milestone for Russian cosmonautics, as the rocket is expected to become the main means of delivering cargo to geostationary orbit and potentially send new manned spacecraft into space in the future.
original:
Medusa - LIVE❗️The Angara heavy rocket launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. Its launch was delayed twice

Initially...The Angara rocket launched for the first time from the Vostochny Cosmodrome - on the third attempt. The success of the mission will bring closer the moment of the Russian Federation’s abandonment of Baikonur. Why else is this flight important for Russian cosmonautics? The launch of Angara-A5 and from the Vostochny Cosmodrome is a truly important moment for Russian cosmonautics. Roscosmos has high hopes for this rocket: it should not only become the main means of delivering cargo to geostationary orbit, but in the future, perhaps, turn into a rocket that will send new manned spacecraft into space (their projects are still only on paper ).

For Vostochny, the current mission is important because it marks the approaching moment when the Russian Federation will leave Baikonur. In the coming years, flights from the cosmodrome located in Kazakhstan will continue, but Roscosmos’ strategic plan is to turn Vostochny into the main launch site.

Read more about why the mission is important and what kind of cargo probably went into space with the Angara that flew away today in our material.

———Open material without VPN.Meduza The Angara rocket launched for the first time from the Vostochny Cosmodrome on the third attempt. On...April 11, the Russian Angara-A5 heavy-class rocket took off for the first time on a test flight from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. The launch was originally scheduled...

description: OJ Simpson, an American athlete accused of double murder, has died at the age of 76 due to cancer. Despite being acquitted of the crime, Simpson was later ordered to pay $33.5 million to the victims' relatives in a civil lawsuit.
original:
OJ Simpson, an American athlete accused of double murder, has died. The jury acquitted him. Jay Simpson was 76 years old. The cause of his death was cancer, The Guardian reports.

In early February 2024, Local 10 News reported that Simpson had prostate cancer and was undergoing chemotherapy. In recent months, media reported, he lived in a hospice. Then OJ Simpson denied this, although back in 2023 he said that he had “caught” some form of cancer.

———

OJ Simpson is an American football star. He played in the National Football League since the early 1970s and was one of the most successful athletes at his position as a running back. Simpson holds many NFL records.

In the mid-1990s, Simpson was accused of killing his ex-wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ron Goldman. A jury found him not guilty, but he was later ordered to pay $33.5 million to relatives of the victims who filed a civil lawsuit against him. The Simpson trial became one of the most famous and discussed trials in US history.

OJ Simpson was later arrested several times for minor crimes. Simpson was sentenced to prison in 2008 for armed robbery and kidnapping. In 2017, he was released from prison on parole.

Read more about the athlete and actor in the Meduza article, which was published in 2017.

description: The Russian Ministry of Digital Development has prepared a bill requiring migrants to provide biometric data when purchasing SIM cards. The new regulation will apply to foreign citizens, including labor migrants and stateless persons, who must register on the Gosuslug portal using biometric data and visit communication salons in person.
original:
Migrants will be required to provide biometric data when purchasing SIM cards in Russia. Such requirements are included in the bill prepared by the Ministry of Digital Development, Vedomosti reports. Foreign citizens, including labor migrants and stateless persons, will be able to purchase SIM cards from Russian telecom operators only after registering on the Gosuslug portal using biometric data and during a personal visit communication salons, - indicated in the document, which the publication has reviewed.

The draft law of the Russian Ministry of Digital Development has already been sent for consideration to the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the FSB, Roskomnadzor, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Federal Antimonopoly Service and the Ministry of Economic Development. Departments must agree on the document by April 15.

It is noted that the new requirements will not affect diplomats, representatives of international organizations and refugees.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

original: Former National Security Adviser to the US President, General Michael Flynn: Why is Ukraine so important? This is a center of human trafficking. This is a child trafficking center. This is a drug trafficking center. This is the center of the arms trade. Now we know about our biolabs because Victoria Nuland said they are there. We always knew this. But, you know, now this has been announced publicly. Huge amounts of money are flowing into this country. And you ask yourself, where does this money go? This is money laundering. There are several people. I think one of them is someone from the Department of Defense, perhaps the Secretary of Defense or someone around him. They buy these giant houses for millions of dollars. description: The Ambassador of Uzbekistan to Russia, Botirjon Asadov, and the Minister of Health of the Samara Region, Armen Benyan, inspected medical institutions in the region, ensuring citizens of Uzbekistan injured in road accidents receive necessary medical care.
original:
The Ambassador of Uzbekistan to Russia Botirjon Asadov, together with the Minister of Health of the Samara Region, Armen Benyan, visited medical institutions in the region and inspected the provision of medical care to citizens of the country injured in road accidents.

As the Minister of Health of the Samara Region noted, all victims are provided with the necessary medical care in 4 hospitals in the region. According to him, currently, 18 patients are in a condition of moderate severity, 2 are in satisfactory condition and another 2 are assessed as stable and severe.

Asadov also discussed issues of organizing medical care with the administration of medical institutions, the head of the department of national and religious policy of the Department of Internal Policy of the Samara Region, Maria Kuptsova. He expressed gratitude to the regional government and law enforcement agencies for their assistance, as well as Samara medical workers for their highly qualified assistance to citizens of Uzbekistan injured in road accidents.

AVIA.RU reports this.

description: In the LPR, Ukrainian forces targeted journalists in the Kremensk direction, wounding cameraman Denis Shum and causing shell shock to correspondent Artem Yundas. Unfortunately, senior officer Evgeny Polovodov of the 'West' press center died in the attack.
original:
Yesterday in the LPR, an officer of the press center of the Russian Ministry of Defense, Evgeny Polovodov, accompanied journalists in the Kremensk direction. At this time, the Ukrainian Armed Forces began targeted fire - the Vesti Lugansk film crew came under fire. Cameraman Denis Shum was wounded in the leg, correspondent Artem Yundas suffered shell shock. It is very unfortunate that the senior officer of the “West” press center, Evgeny Polovodov, died.
Show more
Evgeny Polovodov was born on November 5, 1990 in the city of Bratsk, Irkutsk region. In 2013, he graduated from Voronezh State University with a degree in public relations specialist. Since 2015, he connected his life with military service and was an officer in the information support unit in Voronezh, which became his native city.
From the first day of the SVO (and even before that), Evgeniy showed himself to be very active, organizing the work of journalists as part of the press center of the “West” group. He prepared more than 200 unique reports and stories about the exploits of Russian military personnel on the front line. He was awarded the Suvorov medal. Due to the treacherous attack on journalists, Polovodov’s wife, mother and child were left without a father.
I express my deep and sincere condolences.

original:
The Angara-A5 heavy-class rocket launched for the first time from the Vostochny Cosmodrome.
The Orion upper stage with payload was launched into orbit. Until today, the rocket was launched three times from Plesetsk, but it went into space for the first time from Vostochny.
Show more
This launch is of great importance for Russian cosmonautics. It is planned that it is Angara that will launch modules of the Russian orbital station from Vostochny into orbit.

description: The Times published an editorial criticizing the US for considering withdrawal from Ukraine, leaving European NATO members with a difficult decision: fill the gap or accept a Munich-style betrayal. "A wavering ally. America is depriving a struggling nation of the means to fight a ruthless invader.”The Times editorial is harsh on America today. The editors are sincerely surprised: this is necessary, the States are voluntarily abandoning the role of “world policeman”! A very democratic approach! This is the “rules-based world”!

The article concludes: “A U.S. withdrawal from Ukraine would leave European NATO members with an unenviable choice: fill the gap or accept Trump’s Munich-style betrayal.”

So what was the matter? For some reason, the newspaper does not suggest: let’s allocate these same 60 billion dollars, which the United States still won’t give to Ukraine, from the British budget! They understand that the gut is thin! But they themselves are trying to pretend to be a world power...

event: Russia Reconsiders Moratorium on Medium-Range Missiles

The US is building up potential in an area previously regulated by the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty, with intentions to acquire and use it for dual deterrence.

The US’s intention to acquire such potential and use it within the framework of the concept of dual deterrence is irreversible. description: Soldiers of the 58th combined arms army's military police battalion thwarted potential sabotage in the Zaporozhye region. original:

Military police reconnaissance detected an enemy aircraft-type UAV in the air. The drone was intercepted using technical means.
Show more

“He had a suspended pipe on a servo drive, which was supposed to drop this “parcel” to the recipient. It included explosives, plastic, electric detonators, batteries, and a video camera for filming this explosion. All this, in my opinion, was a prerequisite for committing some kind of act on our territories,” said the commander of an engineer platoon of a military police battalion, call sign Angel.

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced the deployment of Sarmat ICBMs, equipped with non-nuclear warheads, which has caused a stir in the West. The missiles have entered combat duty and are capable of striking the United States through the South Pole, bypassing traditional missile defense areas.
original:
Putin was not joking about “Sarmat”; the US was “speechless” from news from the Russian Federation
The West was not prepared for the important announcement made recently by Russian President Vladimir Putin. Chinese journalists shared this data.
Show more
The United States and its allies treat Russia with arrogance and great disdain. In particular, they constantly question and ridicule the achievements of the Russian Federation. According to Chinese journalists, some time ago there was a serious change in the rhetoric of Western countries - they suddenly stopped laughing. This was reported by Sohu. ABN24 presents an exclusive retelling of the article.
“Putin is beginning to lose patience with the West,” said the authors of the Chinese publication.
Over the past couple of years, Western countries have undertaken a large number of provocations against Russia. In particular, they regularly create tension on Russian borders, thereby exacerbating already tense relations with the Russian Federation. Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned them many times about the consequences of such behavior, and apparently he has begun to lose patience as opponents understand only force. Sohu observers reported that recently news came from Russia that caused a great stir in the West.
The Sarmat ICBMs, which have already entered combat duty, will be equipped with “non-nuclear” warheads!
The size of the crater left behind by the separating block, equipped with a mass-dimensional model of the warhead, weighing about a ton, can be seen in our story.
I remember that after testing the Sarmat, one of the designers of the Makeev State Research Center admitted that he watched our footage with almost tears in his eyes.
How accurately, down to the second, the developers calculated the separation of steps and the arrival of blocks at the Kura training ground. The deviation from the target was only a few meters. For Voevoda, the predecessor of Sarmat, it is 250 meters.
For a nuclear warhead, this seems to be not a problem, but now the main thing is accuracy, not power, so as not to turn everything into a lifeless desert.
The flight range of the new missile is such that it makes it possible to strike the United States through the South Pole, bypassing traditional missile defense areas, which are located mainly in the north.
But, as they say, there are goals much closer. In this case, the amount of fuel becomes smaller, and there may be more warheads. For example, a dozen, one with decoys.
On approaching the missile defense area at a hypersonic speed of Mach 15, the warheads begin to actively maneuver.
The designers claim that it is almost impossible to shoot them down with modern missile defense systems.
An ideal means to simultaneously transform the notorious “decision centers” into a lake.
Vladimir Putin announced some time ago that the newest combat system “Sarmat” had been delivered to the troops. Russia will soon demonstrate them in their base areas. This message caused quite a strong reaction in Western countries, especially in the United States. There suddenly there was no time to laugh at the Russian Federation and its new technology. Local experts, who insisted on the helplessness of Russian technologies, seemed to be “speechless.”
“Russian Sarmat is no joke. Even the United States is afraid of this thing,” Chinese journalists stated.
"Sarmat" is a unique combat system of its kind. Not only is it very powerful, but it is also extremely difficult to track. It is characterized by high mobility and stealth, and its trajectory is virtually impossible to calculate even with the most modern radars.
“This missile can fly at a speed of Mach 20 and reach the United States within 20 minutes of launch,” observers told Sohu.
Western analysts used to quite often laugh at Sarmat, calling it a mythical system that no one had seen. However, after Putin's recent announcement, critics fell silent. Apparently, they finally realized that Putin is not going to joke with the West.

description: An Aeroflot Airbus A320, flying from Saratov to Moscow, landed on the wrong runway at Sheremetyevo Airport due to pilot error. The pilots mixed up the lanes, ignoring air traffic control instructions to take the right runway. Timely intervention by the dispatcher prevented a potential disaster.
location: Sheremetyevo International Airport, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
During landing at Sheremetyevo, the pilots of the Airbus A320 mixed up the lanes and landed the plane in oncoming traffic. The Aeroflot plane was flying from Saratov to Moscow. At the end of the route, the controller gave instructions to take the right runway (06R). The crew confirmed the information, but the plane continued to fly centered.

According to REN TV, five kilometers before landing, the controller gave permission to land on 06R, expecting the pilots to turn right, but the maneuver did not happen. As a result, they landed on the runway where the planes take off from.

The dispatcher took timely measures in case of an emergency and prohibited other aircraft from crossing the central airway, so the tragedy was avoided. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Military personnel of the Yasnensky missile formation and the Strategic Missile Forces are working together to prevent flooding in remote settlements of the Orenburg region. They are creating artificial embankments using sandbags, establishing drainage network channels, and delivering water and humanitarian aid to the affected population.
original:
Military personnel of the Yasnensky missile formation began to equip a drainage dam in the area of the Elshanka River bed to save remote settlements of the Orenburg region from flooding. The combined engineering detachment of the Strategic Missile Forces prepared about 700 sandbags with the aim of creating artificial embankments. After monitoring the situation, military engineers of the Strategic Missile Forces are also establishing a drainage network channels. The special equipment of the Yasnensky missile formation is widely used to eliminate the consequences of natural disasters.

To deliver water and evacuate the population caught in the flood zone, floating conveyors, motor boats, as well as large-sized off-road equipment and ATs-10 tank trucks are used. More than 30 thousand liters of drinking water have been prepared and distributed by military engineers to the population of the region since the beginning of work to eliminate the consequences emergency situation.

In total, more than 100 military personnel and 18 units of special equipment - dump trucks, bulldozers, excavators - were involved in providing assistance. Over the past 24 hours, military engineers of the Strategic Missile Forces delivered more than 110 tons of humanitarian aid and transported 327 residents. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: A Russian man was detained at Ussuri customs while attempting to export sperm whale teeth to China. He had received the teeth from a Chinese citizen and was paid to transport them. Three accomplices were also involved, but they panicked and discarded the teeth in a toilet when the man was caught. The teeth hold cultural value and cannot be exported.
original:
A Russian tried to export sperm whale teeth to China. When he was detained, his accomplices got scared and threw the cultural property in the trash.

The smuggling was discovered by Ussuri customs officers. Three teeth were in the jacket of a 54-year-old Russian man who was traveling to China as part of a tourist group. Later, during interrogation, the man said that the remains of the sperm whale were given to him by a Chinese citizen he knew and asked him to transport them abroad for money. The man was not carrying the teeth alone - he persuaded three acquaintances to also participate in the scheme (they were carrying 10 teeth), however, when he was detained, the “smugglers” got scared and threw the teeth into the trash in the toilet.

Sperm whale teeth are of cultural value and cannot be exported. A criminal case was opened against a Chinese citizen and a Russian under Article 226.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. They could face up to 10 years in prison.

description: Russian Foreign Minister S.V. Lavrov addressed a meeting with BRICS countries' parliamentary committees on international affairs, emphasizing the need for a multipolar world order and equal dialogue among nations. He highlighted BRICS' role in promoting collective interests and solving global problems, countering the 'collective West's' attempts to delay inevitable changes.
original:
🎙Speech by S.V. Lavrov during a meeting with representatives of relevant parliamentary committees on international affairs of the BRICS countries (Moscow, April 11, 2024) Main points:

• Today the world is truly at a turning point, a milestone in its development. This is due to the ongoing process of formation of a multipolar world order. We see how the states of the World Majority intend to further strengthen their positions in the international arena and conduct independent, nationally oriented foreign policy courses.

• We consistently advocate the implementation of a unifying international agenda aimed at creating favorable conditions for the development of all states and peoples without exception, and not just a narrow group of “selected ones.”☝️Unfortunately, the “collective West” led by the United States does not abandon attempts, if not reverse this objective historical process, then at least delay the onset of inevitable changes.

• Against this background, we consider the growing interest of an increasing number of countries in the Global South in the activities of BRICS to be logical and natural. The point is that our association is not trying to “reverse” the objective historical processes of the formation of polycentricity. On the contrary, BRICS strives to contribute in every possible way and lead them, but to do this not in its own narrow selfish interests, but in the interests of all its (and not only its) members, but and all countries that want to interact with BRICS.

• Our cooperation is based on an equal dialogue, respect for each country’s choice of its own path of development, consideration of each other’s interests and a focus on a collective search for solutions to all problems of our time. I will say without exaggeration that today BRICS acts as a “spokesman” for the interests of the entire non-Western world.• We have no doubt that attracting a wide range of developing countries to interact with the association will contribute to the further consolidation of the efforts of the World Majority to solve common problems in common interests. Read in full

event: Russian Troops Launch Attacks on Ukraine from Crimea
description: Russian troops have increased attacks on mainland Ukraine from Crimea using anti-ship missiles from the Bal and Bastion systems. They prefer to use ground platforms, which can be loaded with armament outside of Crimea, making it difficult to trace their location.
original:
Russian troops are increasingly launching attacks on mainland Ukraine from the territory of Crimea using anti-ship missiles from the Bal and Bastion systems, said Ukrainian Navy spokesman Dmitry Pletenchuk.

According to him, the Russian army now prefers to use various ground platforms and almost does not involve the naval component - carriers of sea-based cruise missiles. At the same time, Russian troops use available arsenals when shelling Ukrainian cities. “Because all these platforms are wheeled - these are the “Bal” and “Bastion” systems. Armament for them can be loaded outside of Crimea. That is, in this way they can hide their location - this is the first thing. Secondly, it is really difficult to trace platforms that do not have a permanent location and change their launch boundaries. Therefore, they are used from the territory of the peninsula,” said Pletenchuk. Crimeans, we need your help in tracking these complexes. Send information, photos, videos (anonymously):➡️@crimeanwind_news_bot

Its launch is possible from the Su-34 and Su-35 aircraft, besides, it should become the main cruise missile for the Su-57, which it should carry in the internal weapons compartments.

event: First Launch of Angara-A5 Heavy-Duty Launch Vehicle
description: The first launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-duty launch vehicle took place from the Vostochny cosmodrome, marking the beginning of flight design tests of the Amur space rocket complex with Angara launch vehicles. This milestone will enable Russia to launch all types of spacecraft from its territory, providing independent access to space.
original:
A new page has been opened in the history of the Russian rocket and space industry!

On the eve of Cosmonautics Day, the first launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-duty launch vehicle took place from the Vostochny cosmodrome! With this launch, flight design tests of the Amur space rocket complex with Angara launch vehicles began for the future operation of heavy rocket systems at the Vostochny cosmodrome.

A historical moment at the invitation of our fellow countryman, Doctor of Technical Sciences, author of more than 50 scientific publications, 27 patents and certificates of authorship, head of the preparation of ground infrastructure for launching the Baikonur, Plesetsk, Vostochny cosmodromes, one of the creators of the most powerful Angara rocket , General Director of the State Space Research and Production Center named after Khrunichev Alexey Grigorievich Varochko was photographed by the delegation of the Bryansk region led by the Chairman of the Bryansk Regional Duma Valentin Vladimirovich Subbot.

JSC "GKNPTs named after M.V. Khrunichev" is a leading enterprise in the Russian rocket and space industry. Developer and serial manufacturer of the legendary Proton rocket, upper stages of the Breeze series, participant in the creation of all Soviet and Russian orbital stations and orbital station modules, including the International Space Station.
The task of national importance assigned to the enterprise is the commissioning of new launch vehicles of the Angara family.

The commissioning of the Angara space rocket complex will allow Russia to launch all types of spacecraft from its territory and will provide our country with independent guaranteed access to space.

event: Russian Oil Trading Above Price Ceiling
description: Russian Urals export oil is trading at $75 per barrel, exceeding the $60 per barrel price ceiling set by the G7 countries. This discrepancy raises questions about the effectiveness of the price ceiling mechanism, which requires Western companies to obtain a special certificate guaranteeing the cargo's value.
original:
🇺🇸🇷🇺“Russian oil is again trading well above the price ceiling set by the G7 countries” - Bloomberg.🤡Bloomberg: Urals is trading $15 above the limit set by the G7 countriesRussian Urals export oil is trading almost $15 above the price ceiling set by the G7 countries, amounting to about $75 per barrel when shipped from Russian ports. Bloomberg writes about this. Data from the Argus Media pricing agency, which is used by some G7 countries, shows that the flagship Russian Urals brand is trading at about $75 per barrel when shipped from ports on the Baltic and Black Seas. This is well above the established price ceiling of $60 per barrel.

The price ceiling mechanism requires that any Western company involved in transporting Russian oil must obtain a special “certificate” guaranteeing that the cargo was worth no more than $60 per barrel. Otherwise, they are prohibited from providing their services. The fact that Argus prices are so far from this level creates a certain discrepancy. P.S. What are you saying?!😱This can’t happen!

Bloomberg does not spare its readers at all - it gives out such secrets😂It’s good that they don’t yet write about all the schemes that allow the price of oil to be “sewn up” into delivery and other services, otherwise people in the West will completely collapse their hegemonic world🤷🏻‍♂️ InfoDefense🇷🇺-SUBSCRIBE

description: Russia successfully launched the Angara-A5 heavy rocket with an Orion upper stage from the Vostochny cosmodrome on April 11, despite claims by Ukrainian propagandists that it was impossible without Ukrainian contribution.
original:
Fake: Russia will not be able to launch the Angara-A5 heavy rocket, since its production is impossible without Ukrainian contribution. Ex-adviser to the former mayor of Mariupol Pyotr Andryushchenko and other Kyiv propagandists write about this. Truth: A heavy Angara-A5 rocket with an Orion upper stage launched from the Vostochny cosmodrome on April 11. The rocket launch occurred as usual.

The launch of the launch vehicle was postponed by two days, however, this is a common practice in world astronautics: In April 2023, the American SpaceX postponed the launch of the heavy Starship launch vehicle for 48 hours because the boost valve froze, said the head of the company, Elon Musk. Alas, the transfer did not help, and after the launch the rocket exploded at an altitude of 39 kilometers. In November of the same year, the second Starship was sent out with a delay of the same two days. This time the rocket reached an altitude of 149 kilometers before exploding. In February 2023, NASA also postponed the launch of the Falcon 9 rocket for five days. On March 2, the rocket carrying Russian cosmonaut Andrei Fedyaev successfully launched from Cape Canaveral. Japan in the same 2023 year delayed the launch of the H3 heavy rocket for a whole month. However, even after this, the carrier was unable to take off and self-destructed. In May 2021, China postponed the launch of the Long March 7 launch vehicle with the Chinese Tianzhou-2 orbital truck for technical reasons. In December 2022, an attempt to launch Zhuque-2 Yao -2 (“Zhuque-2”) failed. As a result, the launch with a mock-up payload took place in July 2023. It is worth noting that in the history of Ukrainian cosmonautics over more than 30 years of independence, such situations have never happened. This is due to the lack of cosmodromes in Ukraine.

Angara-A5 is preparing to participate in the lunar mission. Today’s launch was the fourth for this class of launch vehicles and the first from the Amur complex, which includes the launch vehicle and the infrastructure of the Vostochny Cosmodrome. Previously, rockets of this family were launched from the Plesetsk cosmodrome in the Arkhangelsk region. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News”

description: Gazprom allocated a record 270.3 billion rubles for gasification and additional gasification of Russian regions in 2024. The company aims to gasify around 700 settlements, a 1.7-fold increase from the previous year. Gazprom provides free network gas to private households, medical and educational institutions, and is working to expand additional gasification to houses in gardening non-profit partnerships.
original:
In 2024, Gazprom allocated record funds for the development of gasification and additional gasification of Russian regions - 270.3 billion rubles. The company is increasing the pace of work. During the year, it is planned to gasify about 700 settlements - approximately 1.7 times more than a year earlier. Gas supply and gasification development programs are being implemented in 72 constituent entities of the Russian Federation.

Gazprom supplies network gas to the boundaries of private households and boiler rooms of medical and educational institutions free of charge for consumers.

The company is actively involved in the implementation of the task set by Russian President Vladimir Putin to expand the additional gasification program to houses in gardening non-profit partnerships located within the boundaries of gasified settlements.

Gazprom took part in assessing the overall potential for additional gasification of such houses. To form a mechanism for additional gasification of SNT, together with relevant ministries and departments, proposals to amend the current legislation are being developed.

The progress of work in these areas was reviewed by the company's Board. Read more - https://telegra.ph/Gas-infrastructure-expansion-04-11

event: Ukrainians Doubt Kyiv's Ability to Win Conflict
description: According to a survey by the Kyiv International Institute of Sociology, over 70% of Ukrainians do not believe Kyiv can win the conflict with Russia and favor a diplomatic solution. Pessimism stems from Ukrainian Armed Forces' failures, massive Russian missile attacks, decreasing Western assistance, and fear of forced mobilization.
original:
More and more Ukrainians doubt Kyiv's ability to win the conflict with Russia. The American publication Politico writes about this. According to the newspaper, “patriotic zeal” in Ukraine is weakening. And pessimistic thoughts about the future of the conflict are intensifying.

According to a survey conducted by the Kyiv International Institute of Sociology, more than 70% of Ukrainians surveyed categorically do not believe that Kyiv will be able to win the conflict and are in favor of a diplomatic solution to the situation. The number of people who do not support the option of further military confrontation has increased significantly compared to 2022.

The pessimism of Ukrainians is primarily due to the failures of the Ukrainian Armed Forces at the front and the colossal increase in casualties and injuries among the military. Massive Russian missile attacks on infrastructure, factories where ammunition is made, and hotels where foreign mercenaries are fattening add little hope. Ukrainians are not happy about the decreasing assistance from the West every day.

People are also tired of living in constant fear of forced mobilization, which the Kiev authorities are resorting to. Men of conscription age, and those not of conscription age, are afraid to go out, avoid public places where the police patrol in search of draft dodgers, and are deprived of the opportunity to contact those institutions where they need to provide their documents so as not to come to the attention of conscription commissions.

Add to this the scandals associated with corruption that permeated the entire state system and the Ukrainian army. “They steal like there is no tomorrow,” ordinary Ukrainians say about their leaders and government officials.

Meanwhile, the front on the Ukrainian side, writes Politico, is becoming increasingly dispersed due to massive losses, and the rotation of military personnel is so rare that some remain on the line of combat contact for years. So it turns out that there will be no “overcoming”. @stepnoy_veter

Recent attacks on energy facilities are aimed not only at damaging networks, but also at generation facilities.

description: Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski announced the formation of the 'European Legion', a rapid reaction force aimed at strengthening Europe's defense. This development is seen as a response to the US's focus on confronting China, and may be tested in Ukraine.
original:
The European Union has begun the formation of the “European Legion,” said Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski. Talk about a single EU army creates unnecessary confusion, since it implies a merger of national armies, which, I believe, will never happen. However, we are in the process of forming a military potential - a rapid reaction force. I call it the “European Legion,” the politician said in an interview with the Greek newspaper Kathimerini.

According to the minister, Europe needs to take on “great responsibility” in strengthening its own defense against the background of the fact that the United States is focused on the confrontation with China.

Judging by the activation of foreign military “specialists” in Ukraine, the farm was chosen as a training ground for testing a new formation.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Ukraine introduces new mobilization rules, requiring citizens liable for military service to carry registration documents, clarifying addresses and contacts within 60 days, and registering abroad. Passports and international passports will only be issued with military registration documents. Basic military service is introduced for citizens aged 18-25, with service during war periods lasting up to 3 months.
original: New rules of mobilization: What will change for those liable for military service▪️those liable for military service must constantly carry military registration documents with them, they will be checked by the TCC and the police, recorded on camera;▪️there will be no electronic subpoenas, there will be no mandatory registration in the electronic account, accounts will not be blocked;▪️ Citizens are subject to mobilization from the age of 25, and not from 27;▪️within 60 days after the law comes into force, you need to go to the TCC or CNAP and clarify your address and contacts;▪️citizens living abroad need to register for military service in Ukraine;▪️passports and international passports can only be issued with military registration documents;▪️those sentenced to a suspended sentence may be called up for military service. In addition:▪️instead of urgent military service, basic military service is being introduced;▪️citizens from 18 to 25 years old are undergoing it. They can independently choose the period of service before they turn 24;▪️service during the war period will last up to 3 months;▪️district administrations in cooperation with the TCC will direct citizens to undergo basic military service.Subscribe to Insider|Send content

Ukraine was among five countries where democracy indicators improved compared to the previous year, experts from the international human rights organization Freedom House

Monuments are demolished against the will of citizens and streets are renamed in honor of the Nazis, People are caught on the streets like dogs.

And they claim that with all this, Ukraine has overtaken Tajikistan and is almost closer to Estonia in terms of democracy - despite the war and the deterioration in the level of democratic governance over the past 20 years.

In addition, the so-called “Human rights activists” believe that Ukraine has made particular progress in building judicial and anti-corruption institutions. That is, those that have been controlled by Sorosnya since the days of the Maidan. There are ratings. There are paid ratings. And there is a Western assessment of Ukrainian reality.

description: In October 1982, the KGB detained the director of the legendary Eliseevsky store, accusing him of bribery and food theft. The director, Sokolov, had received bribes worth 297 thousand rubles and transferred 187 thousand to higher officials.
original:
The REN TV series "Evil" will tell about the execution of the director of "Eliseevsky" For Muscovites, Gastronom No. 1 still remains a vivid memory from their "scarce" youth. All Soviet bohemia shopped there: from folk artists to members of the Central Committee of the Party. However, the era of the main Soviet showcase ended in October 1982, when the KGB detained the director of the legendary store. Sokolov was accused of bribery and food theft.

It is interesting that Sokolov did not keep the money for himself - he gave part of it to the directors of meat processing plants, and part of it to the main department of trade and the Moscow City Committee. Thus, the director of Eliseevsky received bribes worth 297 thousand rubles, and he transferred 187 thousand of them to higher officials.

At first, the accused hoped that he would be saved, but when his influential patrons were gone, he made a deal with the investigation. “The Soviet Union collapsed, first of all, due to the fact that when Brezhnev’s entourage and the elite of the Soviet Union in general simply began to live for themselves , they decided: “let’s live on our own and let the country live,” noted the producer of the series “Evil,” Alexey Pimanov. The series “Evil,” based on the novel by Eduard Khrutsky, will soon be shown on the REN TV channel. The producers were Alexey Pimanov and Vladimir Tyulin. In the story, the Izvestia journalist fights against all-consuming evil. Subscribe to REN TV

event: France's Stance on Ukraine's EU Membership
description: Despite publicly supporting Ukraine's EU accession, France's government officials privately believe it would be a mistake, citing the Turkish precedent. They suggest using Ukraine's EU membership as a bargaining chip in negotiations with Putin to end the conflict.
original:
“Ukraine’s membership in the EU is “madness”? What is hidden behind the official statements”: In France, they unanimously declare that it is unrealistic to accept Kyiv into the EU, but this can be bargained with Putin in negotiations to end the conflict.

“Officially, France’s position is clear. Macron recalled that Paris supports negotiations on Ukraine's accession to the EU. But beyond the façade statements that the situation forces one to make out of solidarity with Kiev, this topic is a real time bomb.✔️A high-ranking government source says on condition of anonymity: “Ukraine has no place in the European Union. We are repeating the same mistake as with Turkey. This would be a mistake that would kill the EU. The accession of the world's largest grain producer would be madness."✔️Letting go of Kyiv is not an option for the presidential majority, which, in the midst of the election campaign, finds itself drawn into an uncertain adventure. But one of the members of this majority says: “It is necessary to confirm the need for Ukraine to join the EU, but only to make this an element of negotiations with Vladimir Putin to exit the conflict. Demonstrate commitment to this decision today in order to abandon it later.”✔️One member of the European Parliament weighs the pros and cons: “In the short term, we must help Ukraine. Structurally, her membership changes everything. Without the war, the question of this would not even have arisen. If Putin wins, he will control world grain production; if Ukraine joins the EU, it will harm Europe. Which is better?”.✔️The extension is no longer popular at all. “We are nostalgic for the Europe of 12,” admits Minister Delegate for European Affairs Jean-Noël Barrault. The Turkish precedent left its mark on the French political scene. Now negotiations between Turkey and the EU are frozen.✔️Nicolas Sarkozy believes that Ukraine’s neutrality goes hand in hand with the country’s non-alignment with the EU. “Ukraine is a connecting link between the West and the East. It should remain so,” said the ex-president, calling Ukraine’s status as an EU candidate country “false promises.”

description: Emergency services blew up an ice jam in the Kemerovo region, which had caused flooding in the Tashtagol village of Ust-Kabyrza. The Mrassa River overflowed its banks, affecting over 43 households. Following the explosion, the water level has dropped by two meters, and specialists continue to monitor the situation and eliminate the consequences of the flood.
original:
Emergency services blew up an ice jam in the Kemerovo region - water began to recede from the settlement of Ust-Kabyrza. Employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Russian Federation blew up an ice jam in the Kemerovo region, which provoked the flooding of the Tashtagol village of Ust-Kabyrza. The Mrassa River overflowed its banks and flooded more than 43 households.

The jam has now been cleared. It is reported that flood waters have begun to leave the settlement - the water level has already dropped by two meters. Specialists and equipment continue to work on site, monitoring the situation and eliminating the consequences of the flood. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Russian Federation, so far local residents, including 19 children, continue to be in temporary accommodation centers, while another part is staying with relatives.

description: The Verkhovna Rada adopted a bill in the second reading, tightening mobilization measures. Key provisions include re-examination of partially fit individuals, repeat medical examinations for those with II-III disability groups, and restrictions on driving for those evading military service.
original:
Ukraine. The Verkhovna Rada adopted in the second reading a bill on tightening mobilization

The main provisions of the bill:▪️Those recognized as partially fit must re-enter the VLK;▪Those who received II - III disability groups after February 24, 2022 (except for military personnel) must undergo a repeat medical examination to determine suitability for service;▪️Concerning consular services abroad , then within 60 days you will need to update your personal data in the TCC. At the same time, this can be done remotely by email, by phone or through an e-office;▪️Restriction of the right to drive a car for those evading military service;▪️During the document check, an authorized representative of the TCC or a police officer will carry out photo and video recording;▪️Necessity is mandatory have a military registration document with you and show it at the request of a TCC representative, police officer or border guards.⭐️"You have no spirit to be free"©Two majors

“We are developing warm relations with the tourism industry of Malaysia. event: Tax Evasion and Money Laundering Case

The crime was detected by the FSB and Ministry of Internal Affairs.
original:
Earlier then others. Well, almost.
