According to investigators, from 2018 to 2020, the suspects evaded paying taxes in the amount of more than 124 million rubles. Subsequently, they carried out financial transactions with the funds obtained from crime, transferring more than 91 million rubles to the accounts of third legal entities. In addition, due to late payment of taxes, a debt of penalties and fines in the amount of 64 million rubles arose.
 
The crime was detected by operational officers of the SEB of the FSB of Russia and the GUEBiPK of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia.

description: Vladimir Petrovich, a patriot with 30 years of military service, volunteered to defend the Fatherland. He has extensive experience working on various Su-25 attack aircraft modifications, including the Su-25UB, Su-25BM, and Su-25SM3. As an aviation complex engineer, he shares his expertise with young specialists.
original:
Experience is the best teacher. Vladimir Petrovich, as his colleagues and comrades respectfully call him, came to defend the Fatherland as a volunteer at the call of his heart. “I couldn’t stay at home and tried with all my might to get to the Northern Military District,” he says. “I am a patriot, and I’m proud, that I am at the Northern Military District among my comrades. My father, born in 1913, served his military service before the Great Patriotic War, but when the war began, he was the first to go to the military registration and enlistment office and sign up as a volunteer. That’s what I did,” says Vladimir Petrovich. Our veteran has 30 years of military service and extensive experience working on various modifications of Su-25 attack aircraft. Vladimir Petrovich started with the second series of “Rooks”. Today, the tenth series of Su-25 is in service with the Russian army. I studied the Su-25UB, Su-25BM and the newest modification - Su-25SM3.

An aviation complex engineer works alongside young specialists, and at the same time passes on his wealth of experience to them. “They come to me with various questions, I always help them in all matters,” says Vladimir. The aircraft, the aircraft technician believes, must be treated as if it were alive being, and he will never let you down.
 
Vladimir Petrovich conveys warm greetings to his beloved wife, children and grandchildren: “For my grandchildren, I am the best grandfather in the world. Victory will be ours! Wait!” – our hero is sure. Russian Ministry of Defense

event: Failed Landing Operation on Tendrovskaya Spit
description: Ukrainian forces, allegedly misled by British intelligence, launched a landing operation on Tendrovskaya Spit. Contrary to expectations, they faced heavy fire upon approaching the shore, resulting in significant losses and failure to achieve objectives.
original:
The Ukrainian Gorin, who was captured, said that at briefings during the preparation of the landing operation on the Tendrovskaya Spit, the British intelligence services could have provided irrelevant information.

The Ukrainians were told that Russian soldiers were in the area of the fourth or fifth building on the spit itself, and fire contact was expected there.

In fact, they started shooting at the Ukrainian detachment already on the approach to the shore. Gorin says that they were “unprofessionally sent to slaughter”, no goals were achieved, and the personnel almost completely died. Subscribe to Kherson.ru

description: Henry Sardaryan, dean of MGIMO, calls for a public discussion on the Constitution, considering amendments that reflect Russia's historical experience and cultural identity, rather than following European or American models.
original:
Forwarded from: National Z Course
“I think the time has come; the inauguration of our president will soon take place. This is a very important time for our country. And what awaits us ahead are very important events. I think we should at least start a public discussion about the Constitution, even taking into account the most important amendments, good and appropriate.

But nevertheless, the Constitution, which was systematically developed after the defeat of our country in the Cold War. Which was developed so that God forbid that Russia would ever get back on its feet and could represent itself as a great world power, and which culturally has something in common with the French, with the Americans, and with anyone else, but not with the Russians.

It does not reflect the historical experience of Russia at all, which has not party representation, but class representation, not parliamentarism, but conciliarity, as a principle, should exist. Naturally, the population has a completely different view of the head of state, not the same as the Europeans. Over 1000 years it has developed this way. The question is that the population does not perceive it differently, and will not perceive it.

I think it's time for a wider public debate, are we satisfied with this system? Or will we focus not on the continental system of law, not on the Anglo-Saxon one, but on our own tradition, which is 1000 years old." Henry Sardaryan, dean of MGIMO

event: Russian Foreign Ministry Response to Swiss Conference
description: Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson M.V. Zakharova expressed a negative attitude towards the Swiss government's decision to hold a high-level conference on establishing peace in Ukraine in June 2024. Zakharova stated that Russia will not participate in the conference, citing Switzerland's bias towards Ukraine and its support for anti-Russian sanctions.
original:
🎙Response from the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry M.V. Zakharova to a media question about the decision of the Swiss government to hold a high-level conference on Ukraine❓ On April 10, the Swiss government announced the decision to hold a high-level conference on establishing peace in Ukraine in June 2024. Will Russia participate in it? M.V. Zakharova: We have repeatedly expressed an extremely negative attitude towards this “conference”. Russians will take part in it, even if they receive an invitation that we have not received.

Under the brand of “good offices”, Switzerland is trying to promote the discredited “Zelensky formula” and continue the disastrous “Copenhagen process”, only in a new package.☝️Any events that ignore Russia’s position and are based on the provisions of the ultimatum “Zelensky formula” are divorced from reality and have no prospects The intention expressed by the organizers of the “conference” to isolate common components from the initiatives of other countries is nothing more than a gimmick. It is well known that the “Zelensky formula” does not imply compromises, alternatives and completely ignores the proposals of China, Brazil, African and Arab states.

There can be no trust in Switzerland either. It stands on the positions of Ukraine, supports the Kiev regime, applies anti-Russian sanctions, and adopts strategies that exclude Russia from the supposedly existing European security system. By definition, Switzerland cannot be a neutral receiving party, much less a mediator, in such conditions.

The West needs participation in the “conference” of the countries of the Global South only to give weight to some kind of “collective ultimatum” that they are going to present to Russia. We hope that our partners in Asia, Africa and Latin America will be vigilant and will not allow themselves to be drawn into another anti-Russian adventure.

description: Russian courts have handed down over 2,500 sentences to combatants since the start of the full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Most were accused of crimes against military service, while others were charged with 'civilian' crimes like traffic violations and murder. In half of the cases, participation in the war was considered a mitigating circumstance, leading to lighter sentences.
original:
Over the course of two years of war, Russian courts handed down more than 2.5 thousand sentences to combatants. In half of the cases, their sentences were commuted - Novaya Gazeta Europe According to the publication, since the beginning of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, at least 2,605 participants in the war have become defendants in criminal cases. Most of them were accused of crimes against military service, often of leaving their unit without permission.

At least 1,130 war participants were accused of “civilian” crimes, ranging from traffic violations to murder. At least 192 combatants were involved in cases of violent crimes.

Journalists found that in approximately half of the cases, Russian courts recognized participation in the war as a mitigating circumstance. For example, more than 80% of war participants received fines for driving while drunk. The rest of the Russians are most often sentenced to compulsory labor under this article.

Courts make similar decisions under other articles. In particular, for drug trafficking in a significant amount, approximately 70% of the accused war participants received fines, and for aggravated theft - more than 50%.

As journalists write, the only crime for which participants are judged more harshly than civilians is trafficking in explosives. For this, they are given real sentences four times more often than other Russians.

event: Death Anniversary of Sergei Pavlovich Nepobedimy
description: April 11, 2024 marks the 10th anniversary of the death of Sergei Pavlovich Nepobedimy, a renowned designer of missile systems. He designed 28 systems for various purposes, prioritizing efficiency and ease of use. His contributions include the development of high-precision mobile fuel dispensers, fire control systems, MANPADS, and guided missile weapons.
original:
Forwarded from: High Point
April 11, 2024 marks ten years since the death of the head and general designer of the Mechanical Engineering Design Bureau from 1965 to 1989, Sergei Pavlovich Nepobedimy. Invincible is an outstanding designer of the era. He has 28 missile systems for various purposes. He could handle a lot. He knew how to design weapons that had no equal either in the USSR or abroad. Look into the future and calculate the prospects for the development of weapons for decades to come. He kept close contact with the military in order to make his developments as efficient and easy to use as possible, receive feedback and take it into account when designing new models. He devoted himself completely to the cause of strengthening the defense capability of the state. And he demanded maximum performance from his subordinates.

The country's first high-precision mobile fuel dispensers and fire control systems with covert preparation for launch, the country's first and only MANPADS, the most effective guided missile weapons - all this is Invincible.
It put into service tactical missile systems "Tochka" and "Tochka-U", portable anti-aircraft systems from "Strela-2" to "Igla", anti-tank "Shmel", "Malyutka", "Malyutka-P", "Shturm", high-precision guided missiles for combat helicopters and many others.

With great difficulty, but he achieved the development of work on the creation of the Iskander-M OTRK in 1989, which was completed by his followers.

Sergei Pavlovich Invincible is a real legend, whose merits cannot be measured by orders or titles. His name has become one of the symbols of serving his Motherland - devotedly, selflessly and selflessly.@hpweapons

description: Russian Minister of Construction Irek Fayzullin criticized the embankment in Orsk, stating it was not a real dam due to its inability to withstand water pressure. He claimed a real dam would cost more than a billion rubles and be 10 kilometers long. The embankment, built in 2014, cost around 932 million rubles and failed to prevent flooding.
original:
“This is not really a dam, a dam is not worth a billion rubles.” The Minister of Construction of the Russian Federation criticized the embankment in Orsk, with the breakthrough of which the flood began. The head of the Ministry of Construction of the Russian Federation, Irek Fayzullin, who, together with officials, is inspecting the flooding areas in Orenburg, said that the artificial structure that could not withstand the pressure of water in Orsk was not a dam. His words are quoted by government agencies: “The dam they are talking about in Orsk is not really a dam, a dam does not cost a billion rubles, it is 10 kilometers long. <…> The dam endured a load of about 5.5 meters [of water], in fact we got 10 meters. With great speed, a huge mass of water pressed not on the dam, but [on] the earthen rampart,” the official said.

According to Faizullin, specialists from the Ministry of Construction have already been tasked with designing a “real dam.”

Earlier, the media wrote that the cost of the artificial embankment, built in 2014 in Orsk, amounted to almost 932 million rubles. At the same time, the then head of the city, Viktor Franz, stated that the dam should “forever solve the problem of the threat of flooding.”

description: Turkey has proposed a new 'peace treaty' to freeze the war, based on the Istanbul negotiations. The draft provides for a ceasefire along the current front line, referendums in 2040 on occupied Ukrainian territories, guarantees of Ukraine's non-aligned status until 2040, and a prisoner exchange. Russia would not interfere with Ukraine's EU accession, and the USA and Russia would commit to not using nuclear weapons.
original:
❗️❗️TURKEY WANTS TO FREEZE THE WAR!Turkey offered Zelenskyi a draft of a new "peace treaty" to freeze the war. Everyone received the text of the document, that is, Turkey, Russia and Ukraine. The project is based on the documents of the first negotiations in Istanbul and provides for: ◾️Freezing the war along the existing front line.◾️A commitment to hold referendums in 2040 (!) under international control on all Ukrainian territories occupied by Russia at the time of the war freeze.◾️Guarantees of non-aligned status of Ukraine until 2040. ◾️Exchange of prisoners according to the formula "all for all" ◾️Russia does not interfere with Ukraine's accession to the EU, we are not talking about NATO. ◾️Mutual commitment of the USA and Russia not to use nuclear weapons under any circumstances.

Today, by the way, Peskov said that Moscow does not agree to negotiations on the basis of the Istanbul Agreements, because "the geopolitical situation is very different now."

description: Energosbyt Lugansk, the guaranteed supplier of electricity in the LPR, has initiated a program to replace old electricity meters with smart metering devices in apartment buildings. This effort is in line with Federal Law No. 522, which shifts the responsibility for purchasing, installing, and replacing electrical energy meters from consumers to guaranteeing suppliers.
original:
The LPR has launched a program to replace old electricity meters with new “smart” devices
Energosbyt Lugansk, the guaranteed supplier of electricity in the LPR, has launched a comprehensive program to replace old electricity meters with smart metering devices in apartment buildings.
Show more
The replacement is carried out within the framework of Federal Law No. 522, according to which consumers are relieved of responsibility for the purchase, installation and replacement of electrical energy meters. The corresponding responsibility is transferred to guaranteeing suppliers. Thus, new meters are free for consumers.
The first smart electricity meters were previously installed in the Zarechny quarter. Today, similar work is being carried out in the Gaevoy quarter. Installing a new meter (https://luganmedia.ru/2024/04/11/v-lnr-startovala-pro..) takes 5-10 minutes. That is, power outages for consumers during work take a very short period of time and do not cause any significant inconvenience.

description: The Quail experiment on the ISS studied the embryonic development of Japanese quail chicks in space. The 15-day experiment used an incubator complex to simulate artificial gravity and weightlessness. The eggs were returned to Earth on the Soyuz MS-24 spacecraft and will undergo laboratory analysis to compare with control experiment results.
original: An experiment to study the embryonic development of chicks was completed in orbit. On board the ISS, work was completed within the framework of the space experiment “Quail” to study the embryonic development of Japanese quail chicks with the identification of specific developmental features caused by space flight factors. The experiment was carried out in the “Science” module for 15 days. The eggs were placed in the Incubator complex, which supported two types of growing conditions: in conditions of artificial gravity and weightlessness. On April 6, on the Soyuz MS-24 spacecraft, the eggs were delivered to Earth and on the same day transported to the laboratory of biological human life support systems IBMP RAS@imbp_ru. The embryological material recorded on board the Russian segment of the ISS at certain stages of development on earth will be subjected to laboratory analysis. In the future, scientists will compare the experimental data with the results of similar studies obtained in a control experiment carried out on earth. Preliminary results of the experiment are expected in the fall of 2024. For more details, visit the RAS website.

event: Whistleblower Reports Structural Defects on Boeing 787 and 777 Aircraft
description: A whistleblower, former Boeing engineer Sam Salehpour, reported structural defects on Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft, claiming that incorrectly fastened fuselage sections may fall off during flight. The US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has launched an investigation into the matter.
original:
AviaNewsPhoto,🇺🇸Whistleblower reported structural defects on Boeing 787 and 777 aircraft

On Tuesday, an engineer ...US authorities are studying information about problems with the fuselage of the Boeing 787 Dreamliner. Again Boeing, again a quality problem when interacting with suppliers, which pops up during the final assembly of aircraft. Only this time it’s a different plane (787 instead of 737Max) and a different factory. But the recurrence of quality problems indicates that the problems are systemic and, it seems, again as a result of the race of effective managers for profit at the expense of quality.

We hope that our united corporations draw conclusions from the problems of Boeing and P&W, and not just nod in their direction when making excuses about delays.

The text below is taken from Kommersant: The US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has launched a new investigation into Boeing. This time, the regulator will check the claims of former company engineer Sam Salehpour, who claims that sections of the Boeing 787 Dreamliner fuselage are incorrectly fastened together. As a result, according to the informant, over time, parts of the fuselage may fall off during flight.

Engineer Sam Salehpour, who worked for Boeing for about ten years, detailed his allegations in an interview with the newspaper and also filed a corresponding complaint with the FAA. A representative of the regulator confirmed receipt of the request and said that an investigation had been launched.

According to the engineer, problems with fastening the sections are due to the fact that parts of the fuselage over time began to be manufactured by several Boeing suppliers. And these parts do not quite match in shape at the joints.

Boeing denies there are problems with the Dreamliner fuselage. A company spokesman said a team of engineers conducted a comprehensive analysis to determine whether fuselage wear issues could arise in the long term. “These statements about the structural integrity of the Boeing 787 are inaccurate and do not reflect the comprehensive work Boeing has done to ensure the quality and long-term safety of the aircraft. "- says the concern in a statement. Subscribe to @AviaCommentsKommersant US authorities are studying information about problems with the fuselage of the Boeing 787 Dreamliner. Read more on the website

Indonesia is the largest Muslim state on the planet by population, and this country also has the largest economy (16th in the world) among the Muslim world. Also, Indonesia has no relations with Israel in principle, there is no trade, Jakartan recognizes Israel's right to exist, refusing to recognize it as a state.

event: Reaction to US Statement on Moscow Oil Refineries
description: Lithuanian Foreign Minister Gabrielus Landsbergis reacted to the US statement on destroying Moscow oil refineries, drawing parallels with Allied bombing of Nazi Germany's oil depots during WWII. He emphasized the importance of European countries taking initiative in aiding Ukraine and restraining Russia, citing the Baltic countries and Great Britain as key allies.
original: A representative online reaction of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Lithuania, Gabrielus Landsbergis, to the statement of the United States about the destruction of Moscow oil refineries: During the Second World War, the Allies bombed the oil depots of Nazi Germany as the main military objective. victory Although they were not very successful at the beginning, over time the Allies began to deliver one of the decisive blows to the key oil fields of Ploiesti in Romania, which was an ally of Germany and a key supplier of oil. The strange position of the United States of America, to which, in particular, the European Community is reacting very actively . If before the dominance and hope was on the States, today the countries of Europe take the initiative in providing aid to Ukraine and become a key partner in restraining the Muscovites. Here it is worth noting the Baltic countries and Great Britain as the main allies. But, unfortunately, this disunity does not help at all in the fight against the already united evil in the form of Moscow-China-Iran-DPRK. European countries understand this and the indicated reaction is very appropriate due to what European leaders are doing so far everything is possible for the delivery of aid, the USA is trundling senselessly. description: To mitigate the threat of gasoline shortages due to attacks on refineries, companies are adjusting production by redirecting raw materials to gasoline plants, leading to rising prices for toluene. Radical options, such as reverting to Euro-3 gasoline and lifting the ban on monomethylaniline, are being discussed but considered difficult to implement.
original:
⛽️Problems with production are being closed at the expense of other production The threat of gasoline shortages amid attacks on refineries is forcing the government and companies to consider different ways to increase production. In particular, as Kommersant found out, enterprises are reducing the production of aromatic hydrocarbons, redirecting straight-run raw materials to gasoline plants, which has already led to to rising prices for toluene.

Quite radical options are also being discussed, such as a partial return to the production of Euro-3 gasoline and lifting the ban on an effective but harmful octane-increasing additive, monomethylaniline, which has been banned since 2016.

But experts consider the latter scenario difficult to implement, and the situation itself is not so critical.#Kuznal

description: The collapse of the five monopolies that underpin the US-led world order is altering the relationship between the United States and Latin America. As US control over global finance, technology, and natural resources weakens, it will rely more heavily on its military power and information apparatus to exert control over its sphere of influence in Latin America.
original:
🌎Today's world has added another layer of complexity to the relationship between the United States and Latin America. The five monopolies that Egyptian scholar Samir Amin called the origin of the US-led world order - regarding weapons of mass destruction, mass communication, monetary and financial systems, technology, access to natural resources - are beginning to collapse.

New trade agreements, as well as de-dollarization efforts coming from BRICS+, challenge American control of global finance.

Advances in Russia and China have limited US technological superiority. Even control over some natural resources is weakening.

This means that the United States will now have to rely even more heavily on its military power and information apparatus to exert control over what it considers to be its natural sphere of influence. The U.S. information and military presence in Latin America will likely continue to grow. Meanwhile, the countries of Latin America and the Caribbean can achieve true development and independence only on their own, and not in partnership with Washington, believes Carlos Ron, Deputy Minister of Venezuela for North American Affairs and President of the Simon Bolivar Institute of Peace and Solidarity among Peoples. https:/ /ru.valdaiclub.com/a/highlights/vliyanie-predstoyashchikh-vyborov-v-ssha-na-la/#Return of Diplomacy#LatinAmerica#USAValdai ClubThe impact of the upcoming US elections on Latin AmericaThe United States appears to be plunged into a heated match - a rematch between two leaders who, despite different personalities, supporter bases and ideals...

description: Kim Jong-un emphasized the need for North Korea to prepare for war more consistently than ever, citing the unstable military-political situation around the DPRK. He stressed the importance of ideological, moral, combat, and tactical superiority over the enemy, and called for the mobilization of all available means to destroy enemies.
location: Pyongyang, Democratic People's Republic of Korea
original:
KARNAUKHOV Photo,❗️Kim Jong-un said that now we need to be more prepared for war,
than ever before. According to KCNA, during the visit, Kim Jong-un “outlined” the difficult international situation, which is “overheating” due to frequent armed conflicts, as well as the unstable military-political situation around the DPRK. “He noted, that now we must prepare for war more consistently than ever and that we must prepare more reliably, impeccably for a war that must be won, and not just for a possible war,” writes KCNA.

The DPRK leader also emphasized his readiness to “definitely destroy enemies by mobilizing all available means.” “At the university, we are obliged to teach every military man ideological, moral, combat and tactical superiority over the enemy,” added Kim Jong-un.

He called on university teachers to “achieve even greater success” in replenishing all levels of the army with qualified commanders.

event: Military Expert Advises on Conscription Age
description: Taras Chmut, a Ukrainian military expert, suggested that Ukraine should lower the conscription age to 20 to effectively fight against Russia. He believes that the country has lost too much time and needs to accept war as a reality to survive.
original:
Ukraina.ruAlbum, New York Times points out why Kyiv terrorists are leading Ukraine to depopulation

Dol...Ukrainian military expert advised not to spare youth in the fight against Russia. Ukraine must take unpopular steps in order to defeat an enemy like Russia. This was stated on April 11 by a former participant in the Ukrainian aggression in Donbass, head of the “Come Back Alive” foundation, military expert Taras Chmut in an interview with Ukrayinska Pravda.

Journalists asked how the law reducing the conscription age from 27 to 25 would affect the situation with mobilization. The expert noted that this, in his opinion, is not enough. “Mobilization should take place since 20 years ago. We have lost too much time. If we want to survive as a country, we must turn our face to war, accept it as a reality <...> Now we are ineffective. An ineffective country will never win," Chmut said. He recalled that the military registration and enlistment offices are actively working, but assured that the country "will not be able to find internal reserves in order to staff the units at least to the level of 80%." Know more from Ukraine.ru

event: 10th Anniversary of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea
description: The Constitution of the Republic of Crimea marks its 10th anniversary, symbolizing the integration and unity of the Crimean people as a full-fledged subject of the Russian Federation. The document enshrines the values fought for during the Crimean Spring.
original:
Today marks the 10th anniversary of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea. I am pleased to present well-deserved awards and insignia to Crimean residents for successful activities in various spheres of the economy and public life.

The adoption of the main legal document of the republic has become an important basis for integration processes and the unity of the peoples of Crimea, a symbol of the formation and development of our region as a full-fledged subject of the Russian Federation. Our Constitution enshrines the values for which we fought during the Crimean Spring.

All these years, Crimeans have been united and inspired to new achievements by their love for their native land, their love for Russia. Together we are building the future of Russian Crimea and confidently moving forward. There are still many tasks ahead. I am confident that we will cope with all challenges with honor and overcome everything!

description: The final stage of constructing the bridge across the Volga on the northern bypass of Tver has been completed. The metal structure of the span weighs 6.2 thousand tons. The new section of M-11 will improve road connectivity between Moscow and St. Petersburg, boosting housing construction, industry, tourism, and the agro-industrial complex in the Tver region.
original:
Forwarded from: Digital transport
Marat Khusnullin: on the northern bypass of Tver of the M-11 "Neva" highway, the last stage of sliding the bridge across the Volga has been completed. The last stage of construction of the bridge across the Volga on the northern bypass of Tver has been completed! The metal structure of the span weighs 6.2 thousand tons. The last elements that will be installed remain using a crane to connect the two banks of the Volga. The Deputy Prime Minister emphasized that the new section of M-11 will become an important link in the road connection between Moscow and St. Petersburg. The opening of the road will lead to the development of housing construction, industry, tourism and the agro-industrial complex in the Tver region. On the section of the M-11 highway under construction, the state company Avtodor is working to create a safe and comfortable environment for motorists. New infrastructure facilities, including multifunctional zones, noise barriers, as well as biological crossings and livestock runs, will be installed along the road. Moreover, this milestone will allow us to move to a higher level of unmanned cargo transportation along the M-11 highway! Media channel about digital transport. Subscribe

description: A drone fell on a hospital building under construction in the village of Dobroye, Lipetsk region, on the night of April 11. The attack started a fire, damaging the exterior and windows, but there were no casualties or injuries.
original:
In the Lipetsk region, a drone fell on a hospital building under construction. The attack was recorded on the night of April 11 in the village of Dobroye. The drone fell on the building of the therapeutic building of the Central Regional Hospital under construction, said the head of the region, Igor Artamonov.

The fire started over an area of about four square meters. Some time later, Artamonov reported that the fire had been extinguished and the exterior of the building and windows were damaged. According to him, there are no casualties or injuries.

———

The village of Dobroye is located approximately 40 kilometers northeast of Lipetsk. Since March 2024, an air threat regime has been introduced in the Lipetsk region several times due to the threat of drone attacks from Ukraine - last time it was announced on the morning of April 9, and before that on Sunday, April 7.

———Photo from Igor Artamonov’s telegram channel.

event: Russia Sells Oil Above Western Price Ceiling
description: Russia continues to sell oil at prices above the $60 per barrel ceiling set by the West. Russian Urals oil is shipped from Baltic and Black Sea ports to India and China, where it is sold at $75 per barrel, despite Western rules requiring confirmation of prices no higher than $60 per barrel.
original:
Russia continues to sell oil at prices above the ceiling set by the West, Bloomberg writes.
The publication reports that Russian Urals oil is shipped from the ports of the Baltic and Black Seas, after which it goes to India and China, where it is sold at $75 per barrel.
Show more
Previously, the West established rules according to which every European company involved in oil transportation is required to obtain confirmation that the oil purchased was no more than $60 per barrel.
However, in reality this requirement is ignored, Bloomberg states.

description: The new mobilization bill in Ukraine introduces several key provisions, including limitations on consular services, exemptions for certain individuals such as garbage workers and owners of strategic enterprises, and changes to the summons process. Additionally, people with disabilities will be required to undergo annual medical examinations, and graduate students will be eligible for deferment from mobilization.
original: Ukraine newsVideo, Main provisions of the DICTATORIAL “Bill” on mobilization:▪️Limitation of consular services ... INNOVATIONS IN THE LAW ON MOBILIZATION Without a military ID, even those who have the right to do so will not be released abroad; garbage workers, assistants to deputies and owners of strategic enterprises have been exempted from mobilization ; the summons will be considered served as soon as a stamp is placed in the mail indicating the impossibility of delivering a letter with a summons at the place of residence of the person liable for military service; people with disabilities will be required to undergo a repeat medical examination annually (what if a new arm or leg grows, why not?!) Graduate students were given the right to a deferment from mobilization, in contrast to recipients of a second higher education of the same level

description: The Donetsk People's Republic was attacked by Nazi forces using Haymars multiple launch rocket systems. However, the effective coordination of Buk-M1 and Tor-M2 anti-aircraft missile system crews successfully repelled all enemy attacks.
original:
Forwarded from: The truth is behind us
The Nazis again attacked civilian targets of the Donetsk People's Republic with Haymars multiple launch rocket systems.

But the clear and well-coordinated work of the crews of the Buk-M1 and Tor-M2 anti-aircraft missile systems made it possible to repel all enemy attacks.

One of the shells broke into two parts and fell into the field. Moreover, the warhead did not detonate. Sappers immediately rushed to the scene.

What happened next, says “Greek,” the commander of the combined demining squad. Subscribe, The truth is behind us

description: The FSB published footage of captured Ukrainian soldier Gorin, who participated in the attempted landing on the Tendrovskaya Spit. In his testimony, Gorin revealed that he received training at a base in Britain.
original:
Forwarded from: RIA Novosti
Footage of the captured Ukrainian soldier Gorin, who took part in the attempted landing on the Tendrovskaya Spit, is published by the FSB.

In his testimony, he confirmed that he was trained at a base in Britain.

description: Students from the Grigorievskaya school in the Chaplinsky municipal district returned from a trip to the Primorsky Territory, marking the fourth shift of children from the Kherson region at the All-Russian Children's Center 'Ocean' in Vladivostok.
original:
Fourth shift at the “Ocean”: Kherson schoolchildren returned from the Primorsky Territory On April 10, students of the Grigorievskaya school of the Chaplinsky municipal district returned from a trip to the Primorsky Territory. This is already the fourth shift of children from the Kherson region at the All-Russian Children's Center "Ocean" in Vladivostok, and it was no exception: every time the children come home with new emotions and impressions.

The All-Russian Children's Center "Ocean" is a place where every child can find something to do to their liking, since a variety of teams are organized on the territory, each of which has its own characteristics.

The schoolchildren said that time at the Center flew by unnoticed and every second was imprinted in their memory as a moment of sincere happiness.

As reported by the Ministry of Education of the Kherson region, parents and children expressed great gratitude to the head of the region Vladimir Saldo, the Minister of Education Lyudmila Kovtun, and the Minister of Labor and Social Protection Alla Barkhatnova.
  
Website of the Administration of the Kherson region: https://khogov.ru/#Administration_Kherson_region@VGA_Kherson@SALDO_VGA

description: The Verkhovna Rada approved the mobilization bill No. 10449, which includes provisions for re-examining individuals with limited fitness, updating personal data for consular services, restricting driving rights for military service evaders, and mobilizing vehicles.
original:
❗️The Verkhovna Rada approved in the second reading the bill on mobilization No. 10449

Basic provisions: 🗞Those recognized as limited fit must re-enter the VLK. 🗞Those who received the II-III group of disability after February 24, 2022 (except for military personnel) must undergo a second medical examination to determine fitness for service. 🗞Regarding consular services abroad, within 60 days it will be necessary to update personal data in the TCC. At the same time, it will be possible to do this remotely by e-mail, phone or through an e-cabinet. 🗞Restriction of the right to drive a car for military service evaders. 🗞During the document check, an authorized representative of the TCC or a police officer will take photos and video recordings. 🗞Need to have a military registration document and show it at the request of a representative of the TCC, a police officer or the State Security Service. 🗞If citizens have more than one vehicle, vehicles can be mobilized.

description: A Counter-Terrorist Operation (CTO) regime is in effect in part of Nalchik, where security forces are battling terrorists. The militants refused to surrender and opened fire, prompting an ongoing battle in one of the SNT areas.
original:
Footage from Nalchik, where there is a battle with terrorists right now - a CTO regime is in effect in part of the city.
In Nalchik and the Cherkessk region of Kabardino-Balkaria, the CTO regime has been in effect since the morning - activities are being carried out there to detain militants. However, when the security forces offered to surrender, they opened fire. Right now there is a battle going on in one of the SNT.

event: 10th Anniversary of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea
description: The Constitution of the Republic of Crimea marks its 10th anniversary, symbolizing the integration and unity of the Crimean people. It enshrines the values fought for during the Crimean Spring and serves as a foundation for the region's development as a full-fledged subject of the Russian Federation.
original:
Today marks the 10th anniversary of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea. I am pleased to present well-deserved awards and insignia to Crimean residents for successful activities in various spheres of the economy and public life.
The adoption of the main legal document of the republic became an important basis for integration processes and the unity of the peoples of Crimea, a symbol
Show more
formation and development of our region as a full-fledged subject of the Russian Federation. Our Constitution enshrines the values for which we fought during the Crimean Spring.
All these years, Crimeans have been united and inspired to new achievements by their love for their native land, their love for Russia. Together we are building the future of Russian Crimea and confidently moving forward. There are still many tasks ahead. I am confident that we will cope with all challenges with honor and overcome everything!

original: In the suburbs of Nalchik, special forces officers of the FSB of the Russian Federation eliminated two militants. The CTO regime was introduced.

description: A woman who had undergone a mastectomy was forced to remove her breast prosthesis in public at Dublin Airport for security reasons. The security officer did not attempt to search her and instead waited for her to comply. An investigation revealed that the situation should have been handled better, and the airport apologized for the negative experience.
original:
“Dublin Airport staff forced a woman to remove her breast prosthesis in public”: Now at the airport “for security reasons” they can not only undress.

“The woman, who had undergone a mastectomy (surgery to remove the breast), was flying to Donegal Airport. “The security officer didn’t even try to search me. She stood and waited for me to take off the prosthesis,” she complained.
At the request of an airport employee, the woman had to remove her prosthesis in public. She did not know that in such a situation she could ask for a private search.
An airport spokesman said an investigation had been carried out. Its results showed that “the situation should have been handled better.” “We are very sorry that our passenger had a negative experience during his recent journey through Dublin Airport,” he said.
The airport clarified that all passengers in a similar situation can request a private search. It will be carried out by a trained employee."

event: Testing of DST MT-10 Stalker Mine Clearance Vehicle
description: The Northern Military District is testing the DST MT-10 Stalker, a 30-ton unmanned remote mine clearance vehicle. The vehicle is equipped with a striker trawl, allowing it to create passages in minefields containing anti-personnel and anti-tank mines up to 30 cm deep. The operator controls the machine remotely from up to 1 km away.
original:
Forwarded from: Voivode Broadcasts
The newest unmanned remote mine clearance vehicle DST MT-10 “Stalker” is being tested in the Northern Military District zone.

The complex is a steerable tracked vehicle weighing about 30 tons, equipped with a striker trawl, which allows you to make passages in fields containing anti-personnel and anti-tank mines installed in the ground at a depth of up to 30 cm.

The machine is controlled by the operator using a remote control at a distance of up to 1 km.

description: A viral interview excerpt on Twitter/X featured Tokyo residents sharing their thoughts on the possibility of their city becoming as racially diverse as London. While one young girl expressed indifference, others expressed negative reactions, citing concerns about identity, crime, and cultural preservation.
original:
🇯🇵Over the last few days, an excerpt of an interview with Tokyo residents has gone viral on Twitter/X, in which a young girl says that she would not care if her city suffered the same fate as racially diverse London (according to the 2021 census of England and Wales, white the British make up 36% of the population of the metropolis).

However, despite the fact that the Twitter public has already managed to bury the ethnocentrism of the Japanese, and some - to accuse young women of excessive and harmful empathy - all other persons who were interviewed in this interview, including young women, expressed a negative reaction to such a scenario .

"That would be terrible." "Our identity will become unstable." "If you look at Europe and America, violent crime is on the rise there." "The thought of no Japanese people is a bit scary." "They [the British] have a culture that they must protect. And Japan has a culture that we must also protect." 🇯🇵🇯🇵And how would the Kyivans react?
